Step Description.1:
Login to SAP Fiori
Log on  to Fiori launch pad and using  the below URL with login credentials
Step Description.2:
Access the App
Access "Customer Master" App
Step Description.3:
Change Business Partner 
Enter the Business Partner Number in Business partner tab
Click on enter
Step Description.4: Select the Business partner and click on Right side arrow
Step Description.5:
Change the fileds which we want to change like in General data, Sales and Company code data.

For Sales area data will select the sales area = S.Org+DistCh+Div,  and click on rightside arrow it will redirect to Sales area data.

For Company code data Select the company code XXXX  and click on right side arrow it will redirect to company code data
Save

Expected Results.3: Business Partner is diplays in customers tab

Step Description.1:
Login to SAP Fiori
Log on  to Fiori launch pad and using  the below URL with login credentials
Step Description.2:
Access the App
Access "Customer Master" App
Step Description.3:
Create New Business Partner  
Choose Create by selecting Person/Organization
Click on Organization
Step Description.4:
In Create organization Screen Choose Internal numeric numbering  for standard use in Grouping filed
Click on Ok
Step Description.5:
Enter General Information Under Basic Data Tab
Enter the following values in Basic data section 
Name 1 : XXXXXXXX
Search Term 1: XXXXXXX
Step Description.6:
Enter Address Data 
Enter the following values in the Address section:
Street : XXXX
House Number: XX
Postal Code: XXXX
City: XXXXX
Country:XX
Region: XX
Enter the following values in Standard communication section
Language: XX
Click  Check in top will get Check for Potential Duplicates Screen displays
After Click on Close
Step Description.7:
Enter Roles - FLCU01 - Customer
In the Role section  enter BP role as FLCU01  to maintain Sales Area data 
Upon Selecting role Select “Save “Option
Step Description.8:
Click on Sales Areas 
Click on Edit on top
Click on Create in Sales Areas
Step Description.9:
Enter the 
Sales Organization: XXXX
Distribution Channel : XX
Division : XX
Enter the following entries in

Sales Orders: 
Sales office: NL01
Sales Group: NL1
Currency : EUR

Pricing and Statics:
Cust.Pricing.Procedure: X
Shipping: Delivering Plant: XXXX
Shipping Conditions:XXXXX

Billing:
Incoterms: XXX
Incoterms Location 1:XXXXX
Payment Terms : XXX

Accounting: 
Account Assmt Grp. Cust :XXXX

Click On Apply
Click On Save
Step Description.10:
In the Role section  enter BP role as FLCU00  to maintain Company Code data 
Select Role FLCU00  Click on Save
Step Description.11:
Click on Edit on top
Click on Company Codes 
Selct the line and click on ritgh Arrow
Step Description.12:
Enter the  Company Code 1025
Reconciliation Account XXXXXX
Payment Terms XXXX

Click on Apply
Click on Save

Expected Results.5: General Information is added with relevant details like Customer name & Search term
Expected Results.6: Address Details are added with relevant details like Steet, Postal Code, City, Country , Email etc..
Expected Results.7: Business Partner is Created with General data
Expected Results.9: Sales Organization data is added with relevant details like Order Currency, Payment Terms, Planned Delivery time, Inco terms etc..
Expected Results.10: Business Partner is saved  with FLCU00 Role
Expected Results.12: Company Code data is saved with relevant Information

Step Description.1:
Login to SAP Fiori
Log on  to Fiori launch pad and using  the below URL with login credentials
Step Description.2:
Access the App
Access "Create Purchase Order" App
Step Description.3:
In the purchase order app, click on "Create" to start a new PO.
Choose the document type that corresponds to intracompany or stock transport orders (STO).

Under General Information, enter:

<Purchase Group>
<Purchase Org>
<Company Code>
<Supplier> (Select the supplier from the internal master data.)

At Item Level enter,
<Material No>
<Quantity>
<Plant> (Enter the receiving plant (the plant that will receive the goods).
<Delivery Dt>
Step Description.4:
Verify account assignment details, such as cost centers or internal orders if necessary.
Double-check all fields for correctness and completeness.
Step Description.5: Once all the information is entered correctly, SAVE the PO. This will generate a purchase order document number for reference
Step Description.6: If  approval process, then the PO will be routed to the appropriate parties for approval before processing.

Click Continue

Enter the Sold-to Party :XXXXXX
Enter the Customer Refernce : XXXXXXXXXX

Enter the Material : XXXXXXXXX
Order Quantity : XX

Check below entries

Shipping Conditions : XX
Condition types Gross price (PR00) :0000 
 is displayed for free of charge

Sales Order Created

Step Description.1:
Login to SAP Fiori
Log on  to Fiori launch pad and using  the below URL with login credentials
Step Description.2:
Access the App
Access "Credit Memo" App
Step Description.3:
Once inside the Create Credit Memo app:

You will see an option to create a credit memo with reference to an existing billing document.

Select the Billing Document option, and enter the billing document number you want to reference.

Hit Enter
Step Description.4:
Modify the credit memo details if needed, such as changing the quantity, price adjustments, or specific line items.
You can also enter any relevant credit memo reasons or adjust any other terms.
Step Description.5: ave and Post the credit memo directly if you have the necessary authorization.

Step Description.1:
Login to SAP Fiori
Log on  to Fiori launch pad and using  the below URL with login credentials
Step Description.2:
Access the App
Access "Debit Memo Request" App
Step Description.3:
Once inside the Create Debit  Memo app:

Choose to create the debit memo based on a Sales Order or Billing Document (depending on the situation).
Enter the sales order or billing document number as a reference.

Hit Enter
Step Description.4:
Modify specific fields if necessary (e.g., quantity, price, or additional charges).
Enter the reason for creating the debit memo (optional but often useful for reporting).
Step Description.5:
Ensure that pricing, tax, and other financial details are accurate.
Make any necessary adjustments to line items or pricing conditions.
Step Description.6:
Submit the debit memo for approval (if your company requires an approval process), or
Save and Post the debit memo directly if no approval is required.

Step Description.2:

Under General Information, enter:

<Purchase Group>
<Purchase Org>
<Company Code>
<Purchase Doc Type> (Std PO)
<Currency>
<Supplier>

At Item Level
<Material No>

<Account Category> (not applicable for STD)

Check Goods Receipt, Invoice Receipt, Confirmation Control, 
Entery any Text at line item level

SAVE

Step Description.1:
Login to SAP Fiori
Log on  to Fiori launch pad and using  the below URL with login credentials
Step Description.2:
Access the App
Access "Create Purchase Order" App
Step Description.3:
Under General Information, enter:

<Purchase Group>
<Purchase Org>
<Company Code>
<Purchase Doc Type> (Std PO)
<Currency>
<Supplier>

At Item Level enter,
<Material No>
<Quantity>
<Plant>
<Delivery Dt>

Select the correct item category
<Item Category> (Consignment (K), Subcontract (L), Third-party (S) )
Step Description.4:
After entering the material details, click on the Components tab (accessible via the Item Overview or under the Item Details section).

Add the Raw Materials (components) that will be sent to the vendor for processing. These are the materials provided by you, which the vendor will use to manufacture or assemble the finished product.

Enter the Quantity of each component and check for accurate BOM (Bill of Materials).
Step Description.5:
In the Conditions tab, enter the Net Price for the subcontracting service provided by the vendor.

Add any relevant Discounts, Freight Costs, or Surcharges as applicable.
Step Description.6:
Check the Account Assignment (e.g., Cost Center, Asset, etc.) if you need to charge the purchase to a specific account.

Typically, in subcontracting, the raw materials are issued from stock, so account assignment may not always be needed unless it's a specific business requirement.
Step Description.7:
Use the Check button to validate the Purchase Order for any missing or incorrect data.
Correct any issues flagged by the system.
Step Description.8: Once everything is correct, click the Save button.
Step Description.9: Issue Components to Vendor: After the PO is created, raw materials need to be issued to the vendor via a stock transfer (movement type 541 in the MB1B transaction or MIGO in newer versions).
Step Description.10: Monitor Goods Receipt: Once the vendor processes the materials, perform a Goods Receipt for the finished product using MIGO, and the system will automatically consume the raw materials based on the subcontracting process.
